entry.title: Is AI Just a Power Tool for Enterprise Software?
entry.content:
We all remember that feeling ‚Äì watching our friends build a little wood house next to the sandbox, marveling at how quickly they could assemble it with all the power tools available. Similarly, we can build a small tool shed in a weekend ‚Äì a quick project with readily available resources. But try to build a 2-car garage, and suddenly the reality hits: it‚Äôs a vastly more complex undertaking. Even with every tool imaginable, you'd spend countless hours watching YouTube videos, improvising solutions, and inevitably missing crucial details ‚Äì resulting in a structure that doesn‚Äôt meet the family council's standards.

That‚Äôs precisely how AI currently operates in enterprise software development. It can be an amazing ‚Äúpower tool‚Äù ‚Äì accelerating routine tasks and suggesting code snippets. But it fundamentally cannot build a complex, robust software system on its own.

 

Let‚Äôs break down why. The garage analogy is a powerful one because it illustrates the difference between rapid assembly and true, lasting construction. AI can certainly suggest a quick solution for a simple function ‚Äì like generating boilerplate code or completing a basic API endpoint. However, building a 2-car garage requires deep understanding of structural engineering, material science, and local building codes. Similarly, complex enterprise software projects demand architectural judgment, a comprehensive understanding of business requirements, and meticulous attention to detail ‚Äì qualities that currently reside firmly with human developers.

AI coding assistants speed up routine tasks (boilerplate, suggestions, small functions) but lack long‚Äërange architectural judgment, project context, and ownership required to run an entire project end-to-end. AI is used for bigger, more complex tasks, is introducing architectural anti‚Äëpatterns, duplication which result in maintainability and accelerating technical debt.

Responsibility of the code and using AI at the right time is still the coders responsibility. An expert knows "when to use what tool to get the right result.‚Äù Treating AI as a simple productivity booster ‚Äì not an autonomous architect ‚Äì is crucial.

Ultimately, building complex software requires a deep understanding of the business problem and a commitment to maintainability and scalability ‚Äì qualities that are currently beyond the capabilities of AI. Just as you need a structural engineer to design a garage (or a house), developers need architectural expertise and rigorous testing to ensure the long-term success of any software project.

Don‚Äôt expect AI to build your garage (or House)‚Äì or your enterprise software system. Instead, view it as a valuable tool that can significantly enhance the productivity of skilled developers, but not replace them.

entry.title: The Buyer‚Äôs Choice? It‚Äôs SAP BTP!
entry.content:
It‚Äôs been another great year for reviews of SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) on the Trust Radius review platform. Having received the coveted Top Rated award earlier this year, we‚Äôre now preparing to step out in style next year having also recently been awarded with the Trust Radius Buyer‚Äôs Choice award for 2026.

Of course, we rely entirely on our wonderful customers to win awards like this, as they are the ones who are kind enough to share their thoughts and experiences in the reviews they write about us.  Awards are then given based on assessment of review submissions, and with qualification for the Buyer‚Äôs Choice award being made on the basis that 75% of customer reviews rate products as best in capabilities, value for price, and customer relationship, we know that we‚Äôre getting something right. And our prize for this, is a new badge to add to our growing collection.

 

A variety of experiences shared in the form of unique reviews

Customers familiar with the Trust Radius review submission form will know that this follows a set question structure, however the way in which customers respond is always different, depending upon their own system landscape and unique business needs. The result is an extensive list of reviews which describe how customers use SAP BTP in a variety of ways, from integration to user experience, to clean core among others.

Here are some examples of the most recent use cases:

  • Extensibility using SAP BTP to build a SoD software for SAP ERP (15 Nov ‚Äò25)
  • Clean core extensions using modern low code tools on SAP Build (15 Nov ‚Äò25)
  • App development used to build an AI-enabled Promotion Management App (14 Nov ‚Äò25)
  • Integrate & extend to create user interfaces and extensions for SAP SuccessFactors across onboarding and recruitment modules (14 Nov ‚Äò25)
  • Integration with SAP and non-SAP systems (7 Nov ‚Äô25)
  • Integrate & automate to help streamline operations and automate repetitive tasks (7 Nov ‚Äô25)

And this is just a small sample of the 71 reviews that customers have left in the last month alone, but which serve to show how SAP BTP is used to meet the different needs of customers across lines of business and industries, whether in SAP- or hybrid-solution landscapes.

If you‚Äôre interested to read more, then I‚Äôd recommend that you take a look at the SAP BTP review page on Trust Radius, where you‚Äôll find all current reviews listed ‚Äì and you can filter to view those most relevant to you. And if you use SAP BTP in your company, and you‚Äôre inclined, I‚Äôd also welcome you to leave a review whilst you‚Äôre there too, so that you can share your own experience with others.

Happy reading!

Chris Grundy, Product Marketing, SAP BTP

entry.title: msg group Accelerates Innovation with SAP Joule for Developers
entry.content:
Introduction 

Artificial intelligence is reshaping enterprise development, and SAP Joule for Developers in ABAP is at the center of this transformation. msg group, a leading re-insurance and transformation provider, is harnessing ABAP AI capabilities to modernize development, improve efficiency, and deliver more value to customers. 

 

About msg group 

With 25 years of experience in SAP products as well as custom development, msg group specializes in delivering innovative SAP solutions that help businesses run better. As a trusted SAP gold partner, they focus on state-of-the-art solution development leveraging modern ABAP Cloud techniques. 

 

The Challenge 

msg group faced a familiar challenge: 

  • Maintaining and modernizing large, complex ABAP codebases. 
  • Reducing the time developers spend on repetitive coding tasks. 
  • Meeting project demands for faster innovation without sacrificing quality. 

Traditional approaches often required significant manual effort, slowing down project timelines and increasing costs. 

 

The Solution: Leveraging SAP Joule for Developers in ABAP capabilities 

To overcome these challenges, msg group integrated ABAP AI capabilities into their development workflows. With features such as: 

  • AI-assisted code explanation to accelerate analysis of legacy ABAP coding. 
  • Joule Chat capability to support classic ABAP developers on their journey towards modern ABAP Cloud development. 
  • Automated unit testing generation to enhance reliability and reduce errors. 

ABAP AI enabled their developers to work smarter, not harder, freeing up time to focus on delivering business-critical innovations. 

 

The Results 

By adopting ABAP AI, msg group achieved measurable improvements: 

  • 20% increase in speed during the analysis of legacy ABAP code. 
  • Significant time savings for the initial generation of unit tests for ABAP classes and core data services. 
  • Increased developer productivity, allowing teams to focus on critical tasks and support other projects. 

Overall, this meant faster delivery of solutions, reduced costs, and higher satisfaction among all stakeholders. 

Learn more about msg‚Äôs use case here. 

 

Partner Perspective 

‚ÄúSAP Joule for Developers is an essential part of the modern ABAP Cloud developer‚Äôs toolbox. It accelerates development with practical, high-impact use cases while empowering developers to decide how and where to apply it. This approach enables us to deliver innovation faster than ever ‚Äî without compromising the quality our customers trust.‚Äù 
‚Äî Sebastian Freilinger-Huber, Principal IT Consultant, msg group 

 

Looking Ahead 

Building on these early successes, msg group plans to expand ABAP AI adoption across all business areas and projects developed on SAP BTP ABAP Environment and S/4HANA Cloud (Public and Private Edition). With SAP‚Äôs continued investment in AI, msg group is well-positioned to drive ongoing innovation and customer value. 

SAP Joule for Developers now unlocks even more potential with the new Custom Code Migration capabilities. These features streamline the transformation of classic ABAP code for SAP S/4HANA, making it easier to analyze, adapt, and modernize custom code with built-in explanations and guidance. For partners like msg group, it significantly reduces the effort required to transition customers to S/4HANA Cloud ‚Äî while maintaining quality and accelerating time to value. 

 

Learn More 

Want to dive deeper into capabilities and use cases?  

Learn more about SAP BTP ABAP environment and  SAP Joule for Developers to explore how AI capabilities in SAP Build, including ABAP Environment, can transform your development workflows.

entry.title: Major updates to the Attachments plugin ‚Äì multi-cloud support, malware scanning and more
entry.content:
The SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP) model prides itself on enabling rapid application development by abstracting away complexities and letting developers focus on the domain.

CAP‚Äôs Calesi (CAP-level Service Interfaces) pattern takes this further by reducing the amount of boilerplate code developers need to write when integrating with SAP BTP services.

One such example of a useful plugin is the Attachments plugin. The CAP Attachments plugin enables developers to seamlessly add file upload and management capabilities to their applications, handling everything from storage integration to UI components out of the box. By abstracting the complexity of working with object stores and file handling it allows developers to implement secure, production-ready attachment functionality out of the box or with minimal code.

 This plugin has been available for a while and is heavily adopted by the community. In response to developer feedback about missing features, documentation gaps, and bugs, we‚Äôve spent the last few months upgrading the plugin, and the CAP team is excited to release the ‚Äúnew and improved‚Äù attachments plugin for in Java and Node.js.

Here are the latest improvements:

Feature parity ‚Äì with the recent set of enhancements, both the Node.js (v 3.4.0 onwards) and Java (v 1.2.2 onwards) plugins now have the following features:

  1. Multi-cloud support (GCP Storage, AWS S3, Azure Blob) - Deploy flexibly across cloud providers
  2. Malware scanning on upload of attachments. (The Node.js plugin additionally supports mTLS authentication for the malware scanning service)
  3. Enhanced monitoring and logging capabilities

 New features currently available for the Node.js plugin only (v3.4.0 onwards):

  1. Multi-tenancy support for all storage providers
  2. Dynamic visibility control for the attachments panel on the UI using UI5 hidden facet
entity Books {
  status : Integer enum {
    submitted =  1;
    fulfilled =  2;
    shipped   =  3;
    canceled  = -1;
  };
  @ui.Hidden : (status = #canceled ? true : false)
  attachments: Composition of many Attachments;
}

       3. Translations for all model texts in SAP-supported languages

       4. Standard kind to let the plugin automatically decide which object store provider to use

{
  "cds": {
    "requires": {
      "attachments": {
        "kind": "standard"
      }
    }
  }
}

           5. UI5 validation methods to define the maximum file size and accepted media types

annotate my.Books.attachments with {
  content @AcceptableMediaTypes: ['image/jpeg'] @Validation.Maximum: '2MB';
}

You can read the details on the Java and Node.js GitHub pages of the plugin. 

 

And this is not all. We have overhauled the documentation of both the plugins to make sure that you have the latest and most accurate information available.

The team strives to continue enhancing this and other plugins to provide developers with increased productivity.

In case you would like to share some feedback with us, please write to us on cap@sap.com

Ready to try it out? Happy coding!

entry.title: Setting Up Joule Studio for All Partner Flows and Entitlement Levels
entry.content:
This blog was authored by Joule Studio Product Managers: Charan Ravikumar and Maria Kondratyeva

 

Setting Up Joule Studio for All Partner Flows and Entitlement Levels

Joule Studio, the latest capability in SAP Build, enables developers to build Joule skills and Joule agents tailored to unique business needs. These capabilities extend Joule copilot, orchestrate cross-functional workflows, and enhance enterprise efficiency. 

However, we recognize that the partner landscape, with its mix of TDD, PAYG, and subscription accounts, introduces unique complexities. Many of you have asked the essential question: "How do we, as partners, get Joule Studio set up correctly in our environments?"

This guide is built specifically for you. It synthesizes insights from our support channels and direct partner feedback to address your most common challenges, such as multi-global account integrations and navigating the new SAP Build licensing in TDD environments. Whether you're starting fresh or integrating existing services, this post outlines everything you need to know to get started efficiently and cost-effectively.

Let's get started!

Critical Prerequisites: Licensing & Plans

Before diving into the setup flows, let's clarify three critical concepts that are often sources of confusion for partners. Getting these right from the start will save you significant time and effort.

The "New" SAP Build Plan (build-default)

Many partners have existing SAP Build entitlements on a legacy "standard" plan. To use Joule Studio, you must use the build-default plan, specifically for SAP Build Process Automation.

  • Critical Action: Do NOT order a new, separate SAP Build subscription! In your existing Partner TDD Global Account (under a PAYG model), the entitlement for the new plan is already available.
    • You simply need to navigate to the Service Marketplace in your BTP cockpit and activate the SAP Build Process Automation service, ensuring you select the build-default plan during setup.
  • Note: Ordering a new subscription instead of activating the existing entitlement often leads to selecting the wrong plan and creates unnecessary account complexity.
  • TDD Licensing Options:
    • License the Pay-As-You-Go for SAP BTP for cloud test, demo, and development (SKU 8009282). This grants you access to free "Fair Use Limits" for SAP Build (Recommended)
    • Alternative (Subscription): A subscription-based SAP Build TDD developer license (SKU 8019951) is also available, but it does not include the Fair Use Limits.
  • What is Fair Use Limits (FUL): The Fair Use Limit where the partner is provided an entitled specified threshold amount of TDD services free of charge per billing cycle. It‚Äôs designed to support development without unexpected costs.
    • Please refer to this link for more details on FUL - https://partneredge.sap.com/en/library/assets/products/tech_plat/dgl/30/23/SAP1223023.html

  Joule Entitlement 

    • TDD Joule Base SKU: 8020592
    • Joule for Consultant and Joule for Developers are different licenses and not connected with Joule Studio license and its activation.
  • Cost for Custom Skills: There is no additional cost or AI Unit consumption for the orchestration and invocation of custom Joule skills built with Joule Studio's current features.
    • However, the underlying services your skill uses (e.g., SAP Build Process Automation) will still follow their standard commercial models (e.g., consumption against your Fair Use Limits).

The Multi-Global Account Scenario

It is very common for partners to have their Joule entitlement in a TDD subscription based global account and their SAP Build entitlement in a separate TDD PAYG global account. This is a supported scenario.

  • The Golden Thread: The key to making this work is to ensure that both global accounts are federated under the same SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS). This single identity provider is what allows the two systems to trust each other and integrate seamlessly.
  • To run Joule Booster or Joule Formation (see table below), select the 2 global accounts you have.

Understanding Your Integration Flow: Starting Points and Required Steps

This table outlines the five primary scenarios for integrating SAP Build Process Automation (SBPA in the future text) capabilities into the Joule Studio environment.  Identify which flow best matches your current setup, whether you‚Äôre starting fresh or have existing SBPA or Joule subscriptions. This will immediately provide you with the exact action steps and critical notes required for a successful connection.

 

Starting Point

Key Action Steps

The partner is setting up both Joule and SBPA from scratch. 

  • Check the Prerequisites mentioned above. Verify the assignments.
  • Setup SBPA.  
    Setup SBPA Step by Step Video Guide
  • Both Joule and SBPA need to be on the same Cloud Identity Service. 
  • Connect Joule and SBPA by running the Joule Booster 
    Step by Step Video Guide for Joule Studio Activation SAP BTP
  • Verify SBPA Role Collections. (On SBPA Sub Account) 
  • Create Joule Role Collections. (On Joule Sub Account) 
    • joule_extensibility
    • end_user 
  • Finalize trust/security configurations.
  • Verify entitlement/instance setup. 
  • Access Joule Studio.

The partner already has Joule (Booster provisioned) and now links the existing SBPA (it must be a build-default plan) for Joule Studio.

  1. Verify SBPA Prerequisites: Ensure SBPA entitlement is on the build-default plan (standard plan is not compatible).
  2. Setup SBPA.  
    Setup SBPA Step by Step Video Guide
  3. Both Joule and SBPA need to be on the same Cloud Identity Service. 
  4. Update Formation in Joule Global Account:
    1. Navigate to System Landscape -> Formations. 
    2. Select the existing Integration with Joule formation.
    3. Click Include Systems and select the SBPA subaccount.
    4. Check Enable Capability Deployment and finalize. 
  5. Wait for Formation Status to become Ready. 
  6. Verify SBPA Role Collections. (On SBPA Sub Account) 
  7. Create Joule Role Collections. (On Joule Sub Account) 
    1. joule_extensibility
    2. end_user 

The partner has an existing SBPA (on the correct build-default plan) and now wants to add Joule.

  • Check the Prerequisites mentioned above for Joule. Verify the assignments.
  • Both Joule and SBPA need to be on the same Cloud Identity Service. 
  • Connect the new Joule to the existing SBPA by running the Joule Booster 
    Step by Step Video Guide for Joule Studio Activation SAP BTP
  • Verify SBPA Role Collections. (On SBPA Sub Account) 
  • Create Joule Role Collections. (On Joule Sub Account) 
    • joule_extensibility
    • end_user 
  • Finalize trust/security configurations.
  • Verify entitlement/instance setup. 
  • Access Joule Studio.

The partner already has both services (on the correct plan); they just need to be linked for Joule Studio.

  • Check the Prerequisites mentioned above. Verify the assignments.
  • Both Joule and SBPA need to be on the same Cloud Identity Service. 
  • Update Formation in Joule Global Account:
    • Navigate to System Landscape -> Formations. 
    • Select the existing Integration with Joule formation.
    • Click Include Systems and select the SBPA subaccount.
    • Check Enable Capability Deployment and finalize. 
  • Wait for Formation Status to become Ready. 
  • Verify SBPA Role Collections. (On SBPA Sub Account) 
  • Create Joule Role Collections. (On Joule Sub Account) 
    • joule_extensibility
    • end_user 

The partner has both, but SBPA is on the standard plan (requires an upgrade).

  • Upgrade SBPA to the correct plan (build-default).
  • Both Joule and SBPA need to be on the same Cloud Identity Service. 
  • Update Formation in Joule Global Account:
    • Navigate to System Landscape -> Formations. 
    • Select the existing Integration with Joule formation.
    • Click Include Systems and select the SBPA subaccount.
    • Check Enable Capability Deployment and finalize. 
  • Wait for Formation Status to become Ready. 
  • Verify SBPA Role Collections. (On SBPA Sub Account) 
  • Create Joule Role Collections. (On Joule Sub Account) 
    • joule_extensibility
    • end_user 

FAQ & Common Pitfalls for Partners

Q1: I don't see the build-default plan for SAP Build in my TDD account. How do I get it?   Do not order a new paid subscription. Ensure you have the correct TDD account with BTP PAYG license. Then, go to your BTP Cockpit -> Service Marketplace. Find "SAP Build Process Automation" and create a new instance/subscription, making sure to select the build-default plan.

Q2: My Joule and SAP Build are in different Global Accounts. Is that a problem?  No, this is a common and supported partner scenario. The absolute requirement is that both global accounts' subaccounts use the same Cloud Identity Service (IAS) tenant for authentication.

Q3: I ran the booster, but Joule Studio doesn't appear, or I get an error when deploying. What's wrong? This is almost always one of three issues:

  1. Mismatched Identity Services: Your Joule and SBPA subaccounts are pointing to different IAS tenants.
  2. Incorrect SBPA Plan: You are still on the "standard" plan instead of "build-default".
  3. Incorrect Joule SKU: Make sure you have a correct Joule license under Joule service TDD SKU (8018168) at no cost. To be on the safe side, please contact with your account manager, making sure you have right SKU enabled.
  4. Missing Role Collections: Your user is missing the joule_extensibility and end_user roles in the Joule subaccount, or the necessary developer roles in the SBPA subaccount.

Q4: I followed the steps, but deployment still fails with an IdP error: This points to a deeper trust configuration issue. Verify the trust settings between your BTP subaccounts and the IAS tenant. Ensure the Integration with Joule Formation status is Ready. If the issue persists, we recommend logging a free Technical Advisory request via the SAP BTP Technical Advisory service for expert assistance.

Q5: I am experiencing an ongoing issue and require further assistance. How may I contact you? Please submit a free Technical Advisory request via the SAP BTP Technical Advisory service for expert assistance.

Helpful Resources for Setup and Activation 

  • How to get started with Joule Studio
  • Provisioning Joule Studio 
  • Enabling Joule Studio for existing customers 
  • Step by Step Video Guide for Joule Studio Activation SAP BTP
  • Reference Architecture for Joule Studio 
  • Activate Joule Studio in 5 Simple Steps

entry.title: From Insights to Action: Process Excellence by Combining Process Mining, Task Mining & Automation
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs enterprise landscapes, most companies already have plenty of process data, tactical insights ‚Äì and automation tools used; what‚Äôs often missing is a clear path from insight to action. Today, we will discuss how this gap can be closed using SAP Signavio, KYP.ai (SAP Partner), and SAP Build (including Joule Studio).

This post recaps and explains the storyline of the Devtoberfest session, including the demo:

This blog post is a joint work with @ManuelTae - Manuel Taechl (SAP Signavio), Jakub Lutter and Piotr Wisniewski (both: KYP.ai ‚Äì SAP Partner).

 

About SAP Signavio

SAP Signavio solutions help companies connect strategy to execution and increase business agility. In use at more than 3,000 global customers, the SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite strengthens collaboration across business and IT, providing a clear map of how work gets done, which operational systems underlie that work, guidance on potential improvements, and the ability to model and assess the impact of any changes on customers and employees. By giving companies the ability to discover, understand, benchmark, improve, and transform their business processes, SAP Signavio accelerates the journey to digital transformation, operational excellence, and customer centricity. 

About KYP.ai, an SAP Partner (SAP Store listing)

KYP.ai is a Productivity Intelligence Platform that provides end-to-end visibility into how work gets done across people, processes, and technology. By combining data from digital footprints, business systems, and hardware, it uncovers inefficiencies, measures productivity objectively, and enables organizations to drive automation, performance, and engagement improvements across their operations.

KYP.ai is a cloud-based SaaS platform that gives enterprises end-to-end visibility into how work is actually done across people, processes, and technology. By continuously mining operational data from business systems and digital footprints, it identifies inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and opportunities where automation or AI can create value - helping organizations improve productivity, optimize workflows, and align operations with business objectives.

The value proposition centers on four major dimensions: uncovering ‚Äúwhere‚Äù work happens, understanding ‚Äúwho‚Äù does it, seeing ‚Äúhow‚Äù processes and technology are used, and defining ‚Äúwhat‚Äù needs to change to improve outcomes. By doing this, the platform helps organizations reduce manual effort, accelerate execution, improve engagement and drive business results such as margin improvement or cost-reduction.

About SAP Build

SAP Build is SAP's unified low-code and pro-code toolkit that empowers developers, IT professionals, and business experts to collaborate on creating applications and automating workflows. Built on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), the platform combines intuitive visual, drag-and-drop tools with intelligent AI assistance, enabling rapid deployment compared to traditional development. By integrating with SAP Signavio and KYP.ai, organizations can translate process insights into solutions while preserving their clean core architecture.

The approach combining visual development with optional pro-code customization allows SAP Build to handle both simple tasks and complex cross-system scenarios.

SAP Build recently introduced Joule Studio, a new solution that enables customers to create custom skills and AI agents for Joule, SAP's generative AI co-pilot, opening possibilities for intelligent automation and decision support.

 

The Big Idea: Connect Three Worlds

  1. Process mining (SAP Signavio Process Intelligence) reveals how core processes actually run in backend systems.
  2. Task & productivity mining (KYP.ai, SAP Partner) reveals what people really do on the frontend ‚Äì across apps, screens, and tools.
  3. Automation & AI (SAP Build Process Automation + Joule Studio) turn those insights into executable & actionable workflows and AI skills.

Instead of stopping at ‚Äúhere‚Äôs the bottleneck,‚Äù we go through a full loop:

  • Discover issues on a process level
  • Analyze tasks affecting processes at more tactical level (e.g. desktop tools used)
  • Identify automation candidates
  • Build and deploy automation scenarios
  • Expose them as reusable Joule skills to be used with Joule, SAP‚Äôs generative AI co-pilot
  • Measure ROI and improve continuously

High-level view:

 

Step 1: Understand the Process with SAP Signavio

The story starts where many transformation programs begin: with SAP Signavio.

Using Signavio Process Intelligence, the team ingests event logs from core transactional systems (for example, order-to-cash, purchase-to-pay, or shared-services workflows) and builds a digital twin of the process.

Signavio reveals things like:

  • Where cases get stuck (bottlenecks and long waiting times)
  • Rework loops and deviations from the happy path
  • Variants by region, business unit, or system

This is backend-centric: it shows what is happening inside the transactional systems, based on event logs and timestamps. That is incredibly valuable to get the full & detailed picture of the process. What can we add to that? It doesn‚Äôt fully explain why users behave as they do at the desktop level and what happens in tools which we don't analyze with process mining (e.g. Microsoft Outlook or Excel).

That‚Äôs where KYP.ai, an SAP Partner, comes in.

 

Step 2: Go Deeper with Task Mining via KYP.ai

KYP.ai complements SAP Signavio by looking at the frontend and user interactions:

  • Which applications employees switch between
  • How long they spend in each window
    • Identifying patterns for improvement based on copy-paste work, manual data entry, or repetitive clicks
  • How much time is idle or lost in context switching

While SAP Signavio answers:
‚ÄúWhat does the process look like in the system?‚Äù

KYP.ai complement the answer:
‚ÄúWhat are people actually doing on their screens to make this process happen?‚Äù

This combination can be used to:

  • Start from a problematic process area identified in SAP Signavio
  • Then zoom into individual tasks and micro-activities that make up that step
  • Quantify automation & agent proliferation potential based on volumes, repetition, and complexity

This is crucial for AI and automation: many of the best use cases live in fragmented, manual, cross-application work that backend logs alone cannot fully represent.

 

Step 3: Identify High-Value Automation Opportunities

Once both levels of insights are available, the team can prioritize automation candidates:

  • Tasks that occur frequently
  • Tasks that follow a repeatable pattern
  • Tasks that are error-prone or time-consuming
  • Tasks spanning multiple systems (SAP and non-SAP)

This outlines how task-level analytics from KYP.ai help filter for ‚Äúbig automation potential‚Äù tasks, not just any repetitive activity, while also turning the conversation with business stakeholders into something much more concrete:

  • ‚ÄúThis step costs X hours per week.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúAutomating it could free Y FTEs or reduce processing time by Z%.‚Äù

After opportunity identification and assessing the potential, we continue with the ground work for setting the stage for implementation. By using the data that we collected, we leverage the KYP.ai Concierge, an AI-powered assistant, to generate prompts for the agent building. These prompts define the role, workflow, integrations and actions documents needed to build the automation or the AI agent.

At this point, the story moves from analysis to execution.

 

Step 4: Create Process Automation scenarios with SAP Build

With clear candidates in hand, we shift to SAP Build on SAP Business Technology Platform.

Using SAP Build, developers and business technologists can:

  • Model approval flows and automations, both on the API and UI level
  • Integrate with SAP systems through prebuilt connectors, as well as non-SAP systems
  • Orchestrate human tasks and system tasks
  • Develop AI skills and custom Joule Agents (planned) with Joule Studio

Users can benefit from low-code, as well as

  • Instead of starting from a blank canvas, developers describe in natural language
    what the automation scenario should do
  • The tooling proposes a flow, which can then be refined, configured, and hardened
  • In our case, we are able to leverage the prompt that was generated by KYP.ai on the previous step.

This shortens the time from idea ‚Üí prototype ‚Üí tested flow and makes it much easier to iterate as more data from process and task mining comes in.

 

Step 5: Operationalize as Joule Skills and Agents

The last step is how to operationalize what has been built so that it can be:

  • Reused across different processes
  • Triggered by users through natural-language interaction with Joule, SAP‚Äôs generative AI co-pilot

This is where Joule Studio enter, allowing us to wrap automations and workflows as Joule skills ‚Äì self-contained capabilities that Joule can call.

  1. Use Joule Studio to define when and how these skills are used:
    • The goal of the agent
    • The tools/skills it can call (including Build automations)
    • Guardrails and policies for safe execution
  2. Expose those agents to end-users via SAP Fiori, SAP Start, SAP Work Zone, or other entry points.

Instead of a disparate process mining dashboard and a automation tool, there is a continuous improvement loop where:

  • Joule can detect a scenario (e.g., ‚Äúmany open items over threshold‚Äù)
  • Decide which skills to call
  • Execute workflows built in SAP Build as part of the skills
  • And write back outcomes into SAP systems, all under IT governance.

 

Step 6: Measure and improve continuously

Close the loop: Measure the impact of your automations, convert improvements into business value, and feed results back into process and task mining to prioritize the next cycle.

  • Use SAP Signavio to establish baseline KPIs and calculate the monetary potential of fixing the identified issues.
  • Drill into user-level detail with KYP.ai to validate root causes, quantify impact, and construct the prompt/spec for the SAP Build automation.
  • Build and deploy the automation in SAP Build, then wrap it as Joule skills/agents
  • Re-measure the same KPIs in SAP Signavio after deployment, convert improvements into realized monetary value, and publish results to stakeholders.
  • Use those validated results as a flywheel and secure stakeholder buy-in to prioritize the next set of opportunities and accelerate the next improvement cycle.

 

Why This Matters for Developers and Automation Teams

For developers, solution architects, and automation COEs, as well as process analysts, process owners and general set of business stakeholders, the session illustrates a few important shifts:

  • From point tools to an ecosystem
    Signavio, KYP.ai, SAP Build, and Joule Studio are not isolated. They reinforce each other: insight ‚Üí design ‚Üí automation ‚Üí execution.
  • From one-off bots to governed, reusable capabilities
    Instead of scripting ad-hoc automation tasks, the approach encourages building managed automations and Joule skills that sit inside a governed SAP BTP environment.
  • From generic AI hype to measurable outcomes
    Using KYP.ai to detect AI and automation opportunities at task level helps ensure AI is applied where it has clear, quantifiable impact.
  • From manual interpretation to data-driven prioritization
    Combining process mining and task mining means decisions on where to automate are backed by hard data ‚Äì not just stakeholder opinions.

 

How to Apply This Approach in Your Own Landscape

This is something developers can replicate in their own environment. A practical way to start:

  1. Pick a single business process
    Something with clear pain: order management, invoice handling, onboarding, or service requests.
  2. Run process mining with SAP Signavio
    Ingest event logs, build the process model, and identify the biggest delays and rework loops.
  3. Layer task mining with KYP.ai
    Focus on the most problematic steps. Capture desktop activity for a representative group of users and let KYP.ai highlight where time is really spent.
  4. Align with business and automation stakeholders
    Review the top 3‚Äì5 opportunities based on volume, feasibility, and expected impact.
  5. Prototype & create executable process automation scenarios in SAP Build
    Use prompt-based design to scaffold automations, then refine integrations, exception handling, and approvals.
  6. Wrap and scale via Joule skills and agents
    Add the most successful automations as Joule skills, so they can be called from natural-language interfaces and reused across teams.
  7. Measure, prove and iterate
    Use Signavio to capture baseline and post-deployment KPIs, publish these proof points to secure buy‚Äëin, and use them as a flywheel to prioritize the next cycle.

 

This integrated approach offers a pragmatic way to move from dashboards and analysis toexecutable automation and AI, powered by process & task insights, in our daily work.

It is less about any single tool and more about connecting insights to action in one continuous loop.

Thank you for your interest and please share your thoughts in the comments!

 

Related materials for further reading:

From Process Mining to Productivity Intelligence and Transformation

Enterprise Automation with SAP

KYP.ai SAP Store listing
